intro: Endymion kabylicus, commonly known as the Kabylian endymion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to temperate climates. It is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats at moderate elevations. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
